document_data.name: Abazm
document_data.mainbody:
'''Abazm''' was a cultural guide and commercial liaison who operated throughout the [[Dragon Coast]] during the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|Abazm always knows who's on the road to the [[Ginger Palace]].|[[Fowler]], to [[Ruha]] of the [[Harpers]].}}
document_data.Description: He had greasy hair and dressed in a striped cloak.
document_data.Personality: Abazm did not offer up great first impressions, often appearing as shifty and untrustworthy, despite his attempted displays of charm and self-importance.
document_data.Abilities: Despite his personal shortcomings, Abazm was skilled as a social and commercial middleman.
document_data.Relationships:
{{Quote|If the [[Shou]] believe you have no trust for me, they will have no trust for you.|Abazm, to Ruha.}}

While Abazm had an ongoing working relationship with the [[Shou]] royals of the [[Ginger Palace]], he publicly ran afoul of Princess [[Wei Dao]] by bringing to her a merchant that sold [[pearl]] dust that caused her develop a nasty rash. This was just a superficial gaffe however, as he actually served as Wei Dao's secret messenger, bringing her information for her spies outside the palace.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1364}}, Abazm managed to secure a meeting the novice [[Harpers]] agent [[Ruha]], her ally [[Fowler]] who posed as her [[Bedine]] bodyguard, and the Shou royals of the Ginger Palace.
